snippet: The coming leadership transition, sparked by the Communist Party’s ouster of Bo Xilai, was supposed to leave behind the political intrigue of the past.
abstract: Experts say that the ouster of Bo Xilai, the Communist Party secretary of Chongqing municipality who was openly campaigning for a spot in China's elite leadership, illustrates that there is still deep infighting and unsettling conflict within the Communist Party.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting, and Li Bibo contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The coming leadership transition, sparked by the Communist Party’s ouster of Bo Xilai, was supposed to leave behind the political intrigue of the past.

headline.seo: Infighting by Chinese Leaders on Display
headline.main: In China, a Rare View of Infighting by Leaders
headline.print_headline: In China, A Rare View Of Infighting By Leaders
